channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: President Trump says the EU and Mexico will face a 30% U.S. tariff rate starting August 1st
item.description: The potential impact of the new tariffs on key U.S. trading partners could be vast and bruising.

item.title: Reuniting stuffed animals with families after the Texas floods
item.description: People are finding stuffed animals in the dirt and mud that were swept away when floods hit central Texas on July 4. They are working to reunite them with families who lost them.

item.title: Is the FIFA Club World Cup final a barometer of soccer's success in America?
item.description: President Trump will be at the final game in the FIFA Club World Cup, taking place Sunday. Paul Tenorio of The Athletic talks about this moment in the culture and business of soccer in America.

item.title: Why France and the U.K. have a new nuclear sharing agreement
item.description: Jon Wolfsthal on the rationale behind the U.K.-France nuclear sharing agreement, how it reflects a changed geopolitical reality and what the implications are for American security in the new nuclear age.

item.title: Old and new media techniques converge at Sean Combs trial
item.description: Covering the spectacle and complexity of the Sean Combs trial required both modern and old-school reporting techniques.

item.title: How on-screen portrayals of mental illness have changed since One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
item.description: As the Academy Award-winning film One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest marks its 50th anniversary, on-screen portrayals of mental illness and treatment have evolved.

item.title: What happened when Grok praised Hitler
item.description: The Atlantic Writer Charlie Warzel on his new reporting about Elon Musk, Grok and why a chatbot called for a new Holocaust.

item.title: Why everyone is talking about 'Love Island' this season
item.description: This summer marks the seventh season of the USA spinoff of Love Island. Why has this one caught fire in a way that previous seasons haven't?

item.title: South Carolina honors Robert Smalls with first statue of a Black man at the Capitol
item.description: The South Carolina Capitol grounds will soon include a statue of Robert Smalls, a formerly enslaved Civil War hero, among the statues of five white men, most with ties to the Civil War or Jim Crow.

item.title: A look at Syria's growing pains half a year after opposition fighters took power
item.description: In Syria, it's been more than six months since Bashar al-Assad's regime was toppled by opposition fighters after decades in power and years of civil war.
